review_title: Great place to work. Strong leaders and fantastic coworkers
pros: - Strong leadership team - Excellent company culture - fantastic coworkers - great career growth opportunities
cons: I really can’t think of anything

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Toronto, ON
pros: You can work remotely after probation Paid more than minimum wage 2 weeks of training before you are answering calls on your own
cons: Scheduling wasn't always consistent or reliable Time off is often based on seniority No flexibility with scheduling so that you can work another job while employed as part-time staff (essentially need to be available 7 days a week) At the time I was employed I wasn't able to work fully remote, may have changed with pandemic

pros: - team is very kind, supervisor supportive and nice - flexibility is the ONLY other pro
cons: - working with homecare partner is a severe challenge who use you as a scapegoat or complains to offload and redirect angry patients even though the blame shouldn't all be on you - pay is low when you take into account all the additional paperwork and phonecalls - hard to have steady pay, appts might be far from one another and they don't pay for mileage - hard to do a good job when you need to manage 150 plus patients and ppl get angry all the time - no benefits or sick pay - travelling to some areas that don't appear safe on your own

pros: Flexible schedule, hybrid work model, union & benefits.
cons: Lots of unpaid work, lots of driving (unpaid), low wage (per visit rate as opposed to salary).

pros: The starting pay is decent.
cons: The travelling is time consuming as well as costly.

pros: Benefits are good and pay is good. Everyone is really nice. Free training. Snacks and variety of hot drinks in break room for free.
cons: I can't think of any

pros: Flexible schedule Assignments change regularly Variety of clients
cons: Abysmal management due to a possible lack of management training. Having extensive experience as a nurse is not enough to effectively manage other nurses working for this non-profit. Team meetings were often disorganized and unproductive.

review_title: Vha is a great company to work
job_title: Personal Support Worker in Toronto, ON
pros: Good benefits and great team support
cons: Lack of hours and travel time

pros: - good for exposure to Talent Acquisition - great hybrid model - casual office environment
cons: - lots of office politics - low compensation for the amount of responsibility

pros: The work itself is rewarding when you can help clients. Coworkers were a mix of good and bad like anywhere you work! They also have a really good benefits package, including vision and dental. In the office, you do your shift and then go home - no overtime or weekend work which was very nice.
cons: Local management/supervisors went from micromanaging things they knew nothing about to being completely hands off and letting us "figure it out ourselves." They also showed blatant favoritism towards some staff. Very little staff appreciation (cupcakes once a year for admin professional's week). You'll barely even rate a thank you from management for constantly going above and beyond. Also, the remote offices are largely forgotten when head office makes policy changes etc.

review_title: Generally a good place to work.
pros: Nice people who care about the work that they do. Flexible work arrangements.
cons: Overwork at times and not a lot done to prevent this.

job_title: Customer Service Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros:
-High paced environment, you will definitely learn to think creatively
-A lot of times your job is so stressful that you end up building good relationships with your colleagues because every single one of you empathizes with each other
-Benefits are better than most companies
-Good for experience
cons:
-High turn over, the system is designed for failure 
-On a paper perspective it seems that VHA is one of the better paying agency however with the task and expectations they ask you to do, they dont pay enough, as a coordinator you get get paid between $21-25/hr however the job itself feels more like $35/hr
-Emotional abuse from management, one minute they tell you theyre there to support you and to always ask for help, when you do they want you to ask for help from your already struggling colleagues, eventually (which doesnt take that long or much) they pull you into a meeting to let you know how you are performing poorly and question you like you slacked and did not perform at all, at this job you dont have a single moment to breath
-supervisors and managers feel so much pressure that project this onto their underpaid staff
-

pros: Had a great boss, internal growth opportunities were available and encouraged, minimal micromanagement.
cons: There weren't many cons to be honest.

pros: I loved everything about this company. I learned so much and appreciated every moment. The managers are amazing. The employees are outstanding. Highly recommend.
cons: Parking can be tricky in the downtown location.

job_title: Client Care Coordinator in Toronto, ON

cons:
Very long working hours as a Coordinator
Very stressful working environment with high workloads and few psws to execute the work
Constant overtime with very little extra pay
Customer service manager did not create a conducive work environment by playing favorites and pitching workers against each other
Salary was not commensurate to work
Very poor work life balance

pros: Close team, positive work culture, opportunities for learning and grown, ability to work from home
cons: Pay lower than hospital setting, many issues out of our control (determined by Home and Community Support Services), disgruntled frontline workers

pros: Good training, flexible hours, market salary

job_title: Health Services Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: Only pro is the pay is more compared to similar roles at other homecare organizations however the work load is too much and not worth the pay.
cons: Do not work here! Management does not support you at all and micromanages. The work load is too much which leads to burn out and management does not care, instead they say the expectation is to work overtime sometimes even unpaid overtime to finish the work almost everyday. This is a slave plantation. I didn't believe the negative reviews until i worked for VHA myself. Save yourself the time and go work somewhere else. Their turn over rate is extremely high.. You will always see openings for coordinator positions. They also have an extreme shortage of psws so together with the shortage of coordinators it's just a recipe for stress and burn out.

job_title: Health Services Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros:
- Above minimum wage pay
- Full-time hours available 
- Next to TTC station
cons:
- Working very long hours with the expectation to do overtime
- Lack of support from management when starting out
- Part-time employees forced to work full-time hours 
- Weekend shifts as early as 6:30am 
- Stressful job and environment as Ontario is currently dealing with PSW shortage

review_title: Hey, it’s not the worst job out there!

pros: Some of the team members who keep you sane! Location is walking distance off the subway. Rewarding customer service experience.
cons: Management can be more supportive. Not much of a career advancement opportunity. Very poor staff scheduling and requests are not always responded to in a timely manner.

pros: Education opportunities with good benefits. Supportive Supervisor

job_title: Patient Scheduling Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: Pay is okay 22.5. But the work you do is worth 40$ plus. U will have to work over time everyday to finish the days work. I even work through my breaks and lunch ti get the job done.
cons:
Politics 
Lack of unity among coordinators 
healthcare in general is just bad in Canada
Always understaffed

pros: If you want more hours, you need to take over-night shifts.
cons: Provide good paid training, paid workshops. Benefit is adequate plan and also pension plan is available.

job_title: Health Services Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: They have good benefits and sick days. Also staff you work with are nice as well.
cons: After working here for a few years I realized that Vha has the worst management. People are quitting left and right and especially the new hires. That is because they expect so much work to be done from coordinators and little to no help from management or even understanding. They don’t do the work themselves and see everyone struggling but yet instead of fixing the problem and finding a resolution they have a new training group every month. A lot of employees call in sick and that is due to being overworked and for the pay it is just not worth it. They have problems that can be resolved but they have different goals as management and don’t care about loosing staff. When I first started it wasn’t bad and I was able to work here for a few years but seeing all these new people struggle makes me feel so bad.

job_title: Call Response Agent in Toronto, ON
pros:
-Very well organized. Work expected is well defined
-Easy work
-Double screens assist the process greatly
- Benefits for part time workers
- Social committee plans events, also, there are company wide events
- Work from home opportunities
cons:
-Middle Office Management - Bullies, chooses favourites and if you're not a favourite, good luck. Will also get you to train your replacement = lack of respect
-Some fellow workers can be cliquey
-Poor work life balance - schedule can be all over the place and sometimes it's not made far enough in advance and you've got no clue what next week schedule will be. 
- Part time job requires you to be available 100% between 6:30 am and 9:30 PM 7 days a week = no second job or other scheduling requirements other than theirs

review_title: Non profit ran like a for profit
job_title: Physical Care Attendant in Ottawa, ON
pros: Great clients. Laid back atmosphere. Interesting skill set to build. Honestly I only stayed this long because  of the rapport I built with some of the clients.
cons: Scheduling is difficult...expect staff to work short, no casual staff, attitude when staff call in sick, difficult to “self care” when there is no possibility to get coverage. Divide between full time and part time staff.

pros: Helping clients and be around them makes my life worthy. Able to bring out the best of me in taking good care with them confidently with a good heart. No matter how difficult it is, still I will always be there to help and support.
cons: Working in different clients are very challenging, especially with those have behavioral chalenges which I always have the patient to be calm and deal with them in a very nice.

job_title: Call Response Agent in Toronto, ON
pros: Job itself is very easy and quick to get used to. Interactions with callers are also mostly positive and makes you feel valued. Positive work environment with coworkers as well.
cons: Middle management is hard to deal with. Not approachable. Extremely condescending and rude at times. Management expects everyone to be available 7 days a week. Schedules are not flexible. No worklife balance when in office.

pros: I like to help people who need it. Work independently with some help if I need.
cons: Not enough steady hours, too long travel time for each client home.

review_title: They owe me a pay cheque
pros: The three day Orientation was promised to be paid however I have not been reimbursed. The one full day of work was not reimbursed. I am still awaiting my cheque.
cons: Management and human resources are extremely unorganized. The commute times between each shift are minimal, there is a great deal of running around to work locations for the small wage.
